summary: Plus One: Part 4 (John Wick x Reader)
body:
Plus One: Part 4 (John Wick x Reader)

Warnings: fluff, language, SMUT

Word Count: 6.4k (it’s a big boy)

(A/N: and voila, the final part! I’ve had so much fun writing this mini series and I hope this final part lives up to your expectations. Once again, thank you for all your love and kind words, I see it all and appreciate every single one of you. I hope you all enjoy!!)

———————————————————————

“John, this is all so pretty! Look at the petal covered aisle, and oh my goodness, look at that chandelier back there. Do you think I’ll ever be lucky enough to have a wedding as pretty as this?”, Y/N asked, her hopeful eyes meeting his, oblivious to anyone else around her other than the man that stood beside her. Her question caught John off guard, thoughts kicking in of Y/N getting married one day, thoughts of how alluring she’d look dressed in a pristine, white wedding dress, standing at that altar, meeting his own eyes—“earth to Wick? Do we have a copy? Helloooooo?”, the figure beside him mimicked a radio voice as she waved her hand frantically in front of his face in attempts to bring him back down to the present. “OH MY GOD, THERE’S A PHOTOBOOTH, COME QUICK BEFORE ANYONE ELSE GETS IN THERE”, she animatedly cried, making sure he trailed behind her as she awkwardly strode her way to the white booth with the dark curtain divide open, indicating no one else was in the booth. Practically shoving John inside the small booth, she hopped in herself after he sat down on the ‘seat’ that was attached to the metal shelling, taking up what little space there was to begin with.

“Er, Y/N, is this a photobooth or a solitary confinement chamber painted to look like some sort of cute thing, because right now I’m thinking the latter”, he sarcastically said, watching as she stood in the middle of the booth trying to figure out how this would ever work. Swiping the black curtain cover closed, she turned to John and grinned.

“Guess we’ll just have to improve with the seating then”. She quickly sat herself down on his lap, a small gasp being elicited from the man beneath her as her grin widened. Her soft, plush ass pressed into him, John felt his cheeks flush with the sheer contact of her against his most intimate parts. “Are you kidding? $3? We have to pay $3 damn dollars for 2 strips of 4 tiny photos?”, a frown graced her face reflecting the utter disgust she felt, making John laugh at how she was acting like some frugal old woman. Sliding his hand into the inner pocket of his blazer, he revealed his leather wallet, pulling out $3 and sliding the notes into the machine, listening to it whir as it hungrily accepted his money.

“Happy now?” He asked, receiving a response of rapid nodding and a cheery ‘thank you’, with the ‘you’ being elongated into a ‘youuuu’ along with a wide, toothy smile. Selecting the ‘classic’ option, they both readied themselves for the photos. The first photo consisted of them both making goofy faces, Y/N sticking her tongue out and John with his mouth open pretending to look shocked with his eyes wide. The next, both of them feigning ‘cool’ expressions, pouting as Y/N held up the Shaka sign and John made devil horns out of his hands. The third photo contained Y/N with her hands wrapped around John’s neck and both of them naturally laughing at how silly they felt, capturing a moment of genuine happiness and in the final photo, Y/N brought her soft lips to his bearded cheek and gave it a loving kiss, John grinning from ear to ear before he could even react to it as the photo was taken, leaving his mouth agape after the final photo was snapped and making the girl sitting on his lap crack up with laughter at just how shook he looked. Hopping up and snapping the curtain open, she left the booth and waited outside for the photos to be printed whilst John sat there astonished and about 50% more into her— if that was even possible.

“John, look! Look at how cute we are, oh my gosh aren’t we so adorable? This needs to go in some modern art gallery or some shit”. Handing John one copy of the photos, she popped her copy into her clutch and couldn’t help but beam towards John, pure joy and love filling her heart and flowing through every vein and artery, metastasising its way all through her body. John stood for a moment, staring at the photos that he held in his hand, amazed at how easily this girl had made him fall for her. He wasn’t sure how much longer he’d be able to hide these feelings, utter fear building up inside him at the thought of having to let her go or even worse, her letting him go and not wanting anything to do with him. He couldn’t remember a time when he felt so vulnerable apart from one time— when those dreaded words of ‘I don’t think this is working out’ fell out of Helen’s mouth like beads descending from a broken piece of string, the next word falling faster than the one before it. Clearing his head of the bad memory, he popped his photos into one his inner blazer pockets and returned his attention back to the delighted girl, concern breaching those starry eyes as if to ask ‘are you okay?’, which John gave a small nod along with a simple ghost of a smile. “Let’s go find our seats, we’ve been standing far too long for my liking minus my seat consisting of your lap, especially in these heels goddamn it, why did I wear these, John?”, she muttered with frustration, giving a small pout like a tired child would do.

“Well, you thought they looked pretty and despite wearing them, you’re still shorter than me, so…”, John replied, Y/N’s mouth taking an ‘O’ shape of pretend offence, her hand on her heart and giving an exaggerated ‘ouch’, making the corners of John’s mouth lift up. “I’m just kidding, it doesn’t make you any less beautiful and most importantly, any less Y/N”, he softly spoke, bringing his finger to the bottom of her chin and watching as her mouth returned to her normal, toothy smile. “Now, let’s go find ourselves some good seats before we get stuck having to sit next to a weirdo who has no respect for personal space”, he said as Y/N linked her arm around his and they both made their way to the ceremony area.

More guests started to pile in, the area soon full to the brim of a diversity of people taking their seats and chatting joyfully. They both chose their seats between the back and the middle, sitting somewhere close to the end of the row for an easy exit if need be. They both sat close together, John’s knees touching Y/N’s, hands still entwined in a gesture of comfort and support, maybe something even more intimate. “Hey, John, remember when you said ‘stuck sitting next to some weirdo who has no respect for personal space’, I think you were secretly foreshadowing this”, she said as she used her other hand and waved her finger between the two of them.

“No, I don’t think so. I think I was hinting at Phil beside me”, he replied with a slight groan, tilting his head to his right to show Y/N exactly what he was talking about. And he was right. The man sat beside him, albeit was much smaller compared to John (in more ways than one, she thought and tried to suppress a laugh from escaping), had no problem with manspreading his legs wider than need be, his leg pressed against John’s as in some kind of territorial battle for leg space.

“You reckon he wants some of that leg action of yours, Jonathan? I don’t blame him”, she shrugged as John’s breath caught at the back of his throat. “Excuse me, sir, would you mind moving your leg away from my boyfriend’s, he just had some surgery done on his poor, fractured femur and currently has a splint on that leg and any pressure such as your leg against his can be extremely painful, so if you would ever so kindly remove your leg from his, it would be really appreciated”. The man looked at Y/N with a stony expression, opening his mouth to say blunt ‘no’, but before he could, John turned towards his direction and recognition hit the gross man like a runaway train. He’d obviously recognised the infamous man staring him down right now, immediately closing his legs with a sheepish ‘sorry’ as his face turned a bright crimson. “Literally all you needed to do was look the man in the eyes and he closed his legs as if he was born a virgin again. You could’ve saved me from all my waffling by just sending your intense gaze his way”.

“Comes with the reputation, plus I enjoyed your waffling. Boyfriend who just had surgery done on his fractured femur but miraculously can walk perfectly?”, he sniggered.

“Well, considering all the shit you’ve been through, I wouldn’t be surprised if it actually did happen. Not like I’d be able to tell let alone anyone else in this whole venue”, she defended her decision, quickly adding, “and yes, boyfriend”, clearing her voice she said aloud, “yes, everyone, here is my loving, ninja of a boyfriend, John Wick who I adore dearly with my whole heart”. Some heads turned their direction as Y/N laid her head on his shoulder, taking the opportunity to breathe in the scent of John’s cologne and also witness the work of her words on him, feeling the heat of his body rise against his neck as he whispered,

“I thought you said you didn’t want to ‘steal the show at someone else’s wedding’?”.

“Whoopsie, my bad. Couldn’t help it when I’m here with you”. Y/N knew she was playing a game that could go either one of two ways: she succeeds in conveying just how much she wanted John to herself through her animated confessions that she played off as jokes, or she’d completely scare John away, detering him from ever wanting to be near her again let alone hear from her. “John, listen, I’m sorry if I’ve made you feel uncomfortable. You just make me so fricking happy and I can’t help but act like this whenever I’m around you, even if it’s at someone else’s wedding. Please forgive me—”. Before she could even finish her sentence, John pressed his finger to his mouth, shushing her gently as he brought her hand to his mouth, pressing a light kiss to the back of it.

“You’re rambling again. You don’t need to apologise for anything, Y/N, especially not for being you. I know you, and I know you’re just excited and cheerful about being here. I’d rather my normal Y/N than a fabricated Y/N pretending to be someone that she isn’t”. Y/N could feel emotions of affection bubbling inside her and just wanted to scream ‘hey, I think I’m falling in love with you, please feel the same way’.

“3 years later and you still manage to get me with those words of yours. You always know all the right things to say. Thank you, Jonathan”. Before he could reply, everyone cheered as a man in a black and white tuxedo made his way down the aisle to the front, his brunette, pompadour hair impeccable, flashing his bright, white, bleached teeth towards all the faces around the room in a perfect smile. Y/N could feel the hand around hers tighten, bringing her free hand to rest on top of his clenching hand, tracing small pictures over the top of his hand to try and help him relax a bit. Turning her head, she could see how his jaw clenched and his smouldering eyes followed Matthew’s every action.

A few minutes had passed since Matthew’s entrance and John was getting increasingly uncomfortable, his leg jittering up and down in anticipation as if he was the one standing in Matthew’s place awaiting Helen’s arrival, wanting this whole thing to just be over and to just be alone with Y/N watching one of her Disney movies. “Are you sure you’ll be okay through this? We can always go back inside and have a drink or something”, Y/N sincerely asked with worry laced in her voice. John just nodded, not wanting to speak worried that his voice would deceive his answer of ‘yes, I’ll be okay’.

Soon after, all the bridesmaids and flower girls started walking down the aisle, soft music playing as the girls dressed in rosè coloured dresses made their way down the white flooring. Once they had all reached the front, the orchestra had begun to play a gentle piece of music, indicating that the bride was next, everyone moving to stand, patiently awaiting her arrival. There Helen was, bound in an ivory, A-line wedding gown looking as beautiful as ever. Little details of embroidery diffused its way down the dress, crystals stitched on little areas of the gown and around the waist followed by a brush train trailing behind her. Her brown hair was pulled back and up into a bun with a crowned veil attached to the back. “She’s so gorgeous”, Y/N whispered to herself rather than anyone else, astounded by her beauty. The area was filled with sounds of camera shutters clicking, the whisperings of people in awe of such utter beauty and the harmony of the orchestra.

John stood and watched on as the previous love of his life walked down the aisle to marry a man that wasn’t him. She still looked as beautiful as she did the first day he laid his eyes on her, her brown eyes still as kind as ever, the same smile gracing her smile, defining those rosy cheeks of hers. As Helen looked around the area, her eyes fell on John’s, both of their breaths hitching in their throats making it seem like they were the only two people present at that time. Her eyes flickered to the stunning girl on his side, her mauve dress making her stand out among the rest of the crowd who stuck with the bright, pastel colours of beige and light greys. The girl looked at her with inspired eyes, eyes that reflected her pureness, helping Helen coming to the conclusion that she can’t have been any older than 25, her eyes hadn’t seen much in life for long to still have that glow of hope in them. The girl was smiling towards her, not a plastic smile or a malicious one, but a real, tender smile. Helen couldn’t help but return the smile, a mellow feeling replacing her previous melancholic one as she gave John a final glance along with her smile, to convey that there were no hard feelings before she diverted her attention back to the man she now loved—Matthew.

Relief flooded John once he and Y/N were sent that smile, quietening his mind for a little. “She seems really nice, I like her”, Y/N added making John release a breathy laugh.

“Well I’m glad that you like my ex, that’s always good to know”. They watched on as Helen met Matthew at the front, both of their smiles never faltering as they did so. They both did their vows, and while John stiffened at hearing the words ‘I do’ come out of Helen’s mouth, he relaxed soon after he looked down at the angel sat beside him, allowing himself to finally begin to let Helen go for sure this time. Everyone got up on their feet and cheered as the now happily married couple made their way down the aisle and into the reception area, the guests soon followed after them. Once most people had cleared the area, Y/N twirled around to meet John again, her pride for John beaming off of her without her even needing to say a word. She threw her hands around his neck and brought him in for a soothing hug, John returning the hug just as fast as they stood there for a little just like that, revelling in each other’s embrace.

Parting from one another, they walked hand in hand to the reception area, Y/N grabbing two champagne flutes filled with the golden, sparkling beverage and handing one to John. “I know, I know, ‘ugh, why do you drink this stuff Y/N, what’s wrong with you, I brood and only drink expensive, aged whiskey neats’ but it’s free and I think we both need to loosen up after this.”.

“I agree with everything but the ‘i brood and only drink expensive, aged whiskey’” John replied, raising his glass as Y/N mimicked the same with a ‘skol’ as they sipped the golden bubbly, lifting their faces to give the exact same reaction of revulsion, making Y/N burst out laughing as John chuckled along with her, drawing the attention of the people around them but they couldn’t care less.

“We are such annoying guests, no one should invite us anywhere together. And if they do, we’d need some sort of restraining order from each other”, Y/N sniggered as she turned to look at all the disapproving faces.

“But where would be the fun in that, hm?”, leaning closer, he whispered, “I think an assassin and a princess make a pretty good duo, but hey, that’s just my opinion”. The feeling of his hot breath against her ear made a shiver run down her spine, feeling a familiar knot in her stomach tighten at the thought of him whispering other things in her ear in a much different context. Noticing the change in her posture, John added, “what’s going on in that beautiful mind of yours, princess?”. As if on cue, a waiter walked by with a tray full of flutes of champagne and Y/N grabbed another, downing her first one quickly and then downing this one straight after, giving her the much needed confidence boost to deal with the devil in disguise next to her. Before she could reply, again as if on cue, the newly wed couple made their grand entrance as everyone cheered and jeered as Matthew clasped his hands together giving a ‘champion’ pose, Helen close beside him laughing at his childishness.

Y/N could feel her empty stomach cry out for food, the bubbly probably not helping the case of keeping the rumbling of her stomach quiet. “Can we just eat already?”, she mumbled to herself, quiet enough that only she and John would be able to hear her.

“Dinner will be soon. We just need to listen through these speeches and their first dance then we can grab something to eat, does that sound achievable or is that too much to ask for princess?”, John asked sympathetically, though a tone of mischief came through as well, Y/N instantly regretting telling him the idea of her being a princess, but secretly it was doing things to her. Gulping, she nodded as she felt the knot in her stomach tighten even more out of hunger for the handsome man that had been driving her crazy the past three years, especially now rather than for food at that moment in time.

Several sentimental and cheesy speeches later, it finally came to the couple’s first dance. Everyone watched as both of them in an interactional dance, effortlessly reciprocating one another’s movement and gliding through the dance floor, slowing down as the song reduced in tempo as Helen rest her head against Matthew’s shoulder as the song came to an end and the crowd burst into an encore. They then announced that it was time for dinner, and Y/N’s face lit up at the sound of the word ‘dinner’.

—

After dinner, Y/N excused herself to the bathroom to freshen up. She looked at herself in the mirror with the same smile she had on back at home, thinking that maybe this smile would never come off of her face ever again. She took a much needed toilet break to empty her bladder before fixing any loose pieces of hair that were out of place along with her lipstick, spritzing her face with a refresher mist and once happy with everything, left to go look for John. On her way to do so, she grabbed another glass of champagne, gulping the whole thing down in one again as she could feel the alcohol start to course through her blood to liven her up a little, but not enough to make her tipsy or drunk which was the last thing she’d want to do here. As she glanced around the room, a man approached her. He was shorter than John and had a head of black hair along with striking blue eyes, a peppered beard and was clad in a navy blue suit.

“What’s a girl like you doing here all by yourself?”, he asked, the stench of alcohol present in his breath as he spoke and that’s when Y/N realised how close he was to her.

“Oh, I’m not by myself. I’m looking for my boyfriend”, she politely replied. She was never one to be rude even in situations like this. “Look, I’ve found him!”, she exclaimed as the man turned his head to look at who exactly she was talking about before he froze and instantly left. Y/N mentally thanked John for his intimidating self for saving her yet again. John wasn’t alone, however. He was sat around a table, an older man who she recognised as the man that walked Helen down the aisle, along with several other men in tuxedos who she assumed to be part of Matthew’s family. John wore that smouldering gaze again, jaw clenched as he sat up straight, a behaviour he displayed when he got defensive, professionally that is. She guessed they were grilling him about his life currently, post-Helen. Y/N worked quickly to make her way to him, taking long, confident strides towards him, though his back was towards her from this angle.

She got closer, her heels loud enough to give John a heads up that it was her and not someone sneaking up on him. She bent down, wrapping her arms around him in a soft embrace as part of her ‘mission: save John’, pressing a small kiss against his cheek. “I’m sorry I was gone so long, sweetie. I got lost on my way there and then I got a phone call from Will, you know the one from project management about the recent research conducted out on the Ligand binding assay and he just kept waffling, bless him—oh my gosh, I’m so sorry for interrupting! Where are my manners? Hi, I’m Y/N, John’s girlfriend. So nice to meet you all”. They all sat with their eyes practically bulging out of their sockets, mouths agape but Y/N wasn’t sure whether it was her waffling about some weird pharma model or if she’d just grown an extra head.

“Oh, it’s okay, love. Me and the guys here were just having a friendly conversation on just how lucky I’ve been to have such a wonderful woman like you in my life. I hope everything’s okay with Will?”, John replied back, going along with the act you started.

“Everything’s fine with Will, he just wanted to clarify some details with me about our next research project. And, stop it you. I’m the lucky one, Jonathan Wick. You best have played nice with the boys here”, she said, applying some emphasis on the word ‘boys’ as she turned to look at the other faces surrounding the table, letting her hands roam John’s chest as she lightly padded her fingers across his stiff torso. “I’d hate to do this, but I need to borrow my dear, John here. You take care of yourselves, boys.”, she finished a John bid them all a ‘good evening’ as he got up from the table, and much to Y/N’s surprise, wrapped his arm around her waist. Y/N made sure to swing her hips a little as she strutted away from them, a grin plastered to her face as people moved out of their way, parting like Noah and the Red Sea. “You were right, a princess and an assassin do make a great duo”.

“Or maybe it’s just us”, he murmured back, feeling the effect of Y/N dig into his soul, clouding any other thought apart from her hands roaming his chest. “Thanks for saving me back there, those assholes wouldn’t drop the whole ‘so tell us how shit your life is now without Helen’, not in those exact words but close enough”.

“It was worth it to see all their dumb faces so shook. They need to do something better with their lives asap”.

They were close approaching the dance floor, and a familiar midtempo love ballad that Y/N knew all too well began to play. Grabbing his hand, she tugged him towards the dance floor. “Can we have this one dance, please? This is one of my favourite songs ever”, she quietly asked, wide eyes staring up at him with such adoration that he couldn’t say no. Wrapping his arms around her waist, she did the same with hers wrapping around his neck, bringing his head down closer to hers. Y/N softly sang the words to the song into his ear, “I’ll trade your broken wings for mine, I’ve seen your scars and kissed your crimes”, John immediately relaxed into her, her soft voice along with the lyrics and beautiful taking a toll. “Sweet love all night long, all I wanna, ain’t no other, we together, I remember, sweet love all night long”. Y/N moved her face from his shoulder, making John gaze into her heavenly eyes again as she sang, “they say true love’s the greatest weapon, to win the war caused by pain, but every diamond has imperfections, but my love’s too pure to watch it chip away”.

Y/N could feel her eyes build with water, her feelings towards John too overwhelming to push away any longer. John felt it too, the ache of his heart longing to have Y/N. They both couldn’t do it anymore. The song was nearing its end, and John whispered, “if you don’t want this, then move away now”. When he saw her still standing there, he made his move. He slowly leaned in, close enough to feel her breath against his mouth before Y/N finally closed the gap between them. The kiss was passionate and had no rush to it, both of them savouring the taste of each other. They had both waited three years for this to happen, and here it was. And boy, did it feel good. Their mouths moved in sync with one another before Y/N had to move away and gasp for oxygen . The song came to a gentle stop as another started playing, eyes were glued to John and Y/N staring in wonder at the moment they’d just shared. They hadn’t noticed Helen’s eyes on them too, watching on as warmth filled her heart to see John finally with someone that made him feel as though the sun was something built for him in a tool shed.

“I’ve waited three damn years for that, Wick, and it was so damn worth it.”, Y/N admitted, as she brought her fingers up to his lips to wipe her lipstick off of them.

“I know, because so have I”. Y/N released a big yawn, the food, slow music and waking up at 5am aiding her into a tired state. “Someone looks tired. Come on, let’s go home”. Y/N attempted to argue against him but then thoughts of better things happening outside of this place goaded her into agreeing with him and letting him win the battle of whether to stay or leave. John retrieved his car from the valet, opening the door one last time for Y/N to hop in as he did the same. Y/N undid her heels and slid them off her sore feet, sighing in relief at the feeling no longer having her feet encaged in a torture machine.

They both drove in a blissful silence, quiet music filling the atmosphere, creating a safe space for the both of them. The clear roads meant that they arrived back at Y/N’s place faster than it would’ve usually taken.

“I really enjoyed today, thank you for bringing me as your plus one and allowing me to live my guilty pleasure of being a princess for one day in my life, Prince Charming”

“If I had known today would’ve gone the way it did, I would’ve never contemplated not going. Thank you for coming with me, I don’t know how I would have survived the day without your presence”. Y/N looked hesitantly at him, worried if her next words would make or break their current relationship for good but she had to try.

“John, I’ve been meaning to tell you something for a really long time now but I never knew if you’d feel the same way so I never did because I didn’t want to lose you.”, she started as John listened intently to her words, his brow slightly furrowed. “I really like you, John Wick. I’ve liked you for a really long time now and I’ve been bursting at the seams to tell y—”

“I really like you too, Y/N. Fuck, you’ve been driving me up a wall since the first day we properly met. And your hijinks today? Sitting on my lap in the photobooth? Kissing my cheek? All the suggestive things you said? Calling me your boyfriend the whole day? Rubbing your hands up and down my chest? And don’t think I didn’t notice the way you swayed those fucking gorgeous hips.”. ‘So he did notice all these little things’, she thought to herself, feeling her pride build up as that knot in her stomach returned. Y/N undid her seatbelt and climbed over quickly, but carefully, to John’s seat, straddling his lap.

“I need you so badly, John”, she said in a hushed tone as she sat herself down on his lap, her burning hot core against his clothed member, John’s eyes beginning to cloud with the same lust that filled Y/N’s eyes.

“Tell me what you want me to do to you”, John’s voice rumbled in a low tone, a tone he’d only ever used when out on his ‘business ventures’ but it made the sweet girl on his lap even wetter, feeling a wet spot forming over the crotch of his trousers from it soaking through her panties.

“I want you to fuck me. I need you to fuck me. I need to feel you inside of me, please John, please fuck me”, she moaned, looking at him with pleading eyes, instantly making John hard against her. Pulling the straps of her dress down, she revealed the blue bra she chose to wear in case this did happen. Unfastening her bra, she threw it over to the passenger seat as John responded with a low moan at the sight of her beautiful breasts.

Reaching out, the calloused padding of his hands cupped her perfect, smooth breasts, fondling them with extra care as Y/N bit her lip to prevent a moan from escaping her mouth. He moved his fingers to her hardened nipples and used his index finger and thumb to gently roll the peaks between them, tugging slightly at them as he watched the girl in front of him become undone. Leaning forward, he brought his lips to her breasts, covering them each in small, subtle kisses and then moving his attention back to her nipples again, running his tongue up against them, the air now hitting her peaks becoming cold, making Y/N delve in the sensitivity it brought about. Sensing that the cold air was increasing her sensitivity, John purposely blew air from out of his mouth against her stiffened peaks. “Does that feel good, princess?”, the man beneath her asked, Y/N’s heart fluttering at the pet name he adopted for her. Nodding furiously, she tried to reply with a ‘yes’ until the ‘yes’ stretched out into a melodious moan. summary: 3 yaşımdayken babamın bizi terk edişini gördüm. 4 tane farklı okula kaydoldum ve disleksiyle mücadele ettim ki bu benim eğitim...
caption:
3 yaşımdayken babamın bizi terk edişini gördüm.
4 tane farklı okula kaydoldum ve disleksiyle mücadele ettim ki bu benim eğitim hayatımı daha da zorlaştırıyordu.
Sonunda okulu diploma alamadan bıraktım. 23 yaşımdayken en yakın arkadaşım River Phoenix yüksek dozda uyuşturucudan öldü.
1998’de Jennifer Syme ile tanıştım.
Anında aşık olduk ve 1999’da Jennifer kızımıza hamile kaldı.
Çok üzücü bir şekilde 8 ay sonra çocuğumuz ölü doğdu.
Onun ölümüyle harap olduk ve bu bizim ilişkimizi sona erdirdi.
18 ay sonra Jennifer bir araba kazasında öldü. O zamandan sonra ciddi ilişkilerden ve çocuk sahibi olmaktan uzak durdum.
En küçük kız kardeşim lösemi oldu.
Şimdi o tedavi oldu ve ben Matrix filmlerinden kazandığım paranın %70’ini lösemiyi tedavi etmek için hastanelere bağış yaptım.
Ben malikanesi olmayan nadir Hollywood Yıldızlarından biriyim.
Hiçbir bodyguardım yok ve süslü püslü moda giysiler giymem. 100 milyon dolar değerim olsa bile hala metroya biniyorum ve bunu seviyorum.
Sonuçta sanıyorum hepimiz aynı fikirdeyiz ki bir trajedinin içinde bile bir yıldız yetişebiliyor. Hayatınızda ne olup bittiğinin bir önemi yok, hepsinin üstesinden gelebilirsiniz.
Hayat yaşamaya değer…

Keanu Reeves

body:
Person: Do you know who Keanu Reeves is?

Me: Keanu Reeves? Born Keanu Charles Reeves on September 2, 1964? The man whose first name means “cool breeze over the mountains” in Hawaiian? The Canadian-American actor who’s starred in films such as the Bill and Ted franchise, Point Break, My Own Private Idaho, Speed, The Matrix trilogy, Constantine, the John Wick franchise, Toy Story 4, etc.? The man who’s played bass in bands such as Dogstar and Becky? The man who gives a lot of his money to people who are in need or to charities? The guy that is always up for meeting fans? The man who’s helped people when their vehicles were broken down, took pay cuts in movies so that others could get paid more, chatted with a homeless man and shared his snacks with him, and rented a van for himself and his fellow stranded plane passengers? Never heard of him.

blog.description: Need a place you can discuss your favorite DC stories, films, heroes, and villains without the unnecessary hate? This is the blog for you! This is a place to discuss news and anticipation for upcoming DCEU projects as well as express appreciation for the already existing stories and films we have come to love produced by DC. Marvel fans are welcome to follow just as long as they are civil and respectful towards us. This is a DC fanblog, and while we may offer constructive criticism to what we love, we will not tolerate nonconstructive criticism that only serves to attempt to make what we love less enjoyable. We get enough of that outside of this blog, so we will not tolerate it here.This blog is also ran by a queer Black intersectional feminist.BEFORE YOU FOLLOW, KNOW THIS: I do make posts that discuss and call out fandom racism. I will not sugar coat anything on the subject.

Marvel fans are welcome to follow just as long as they are civil and respectful towards us. This is a DC fanblog, and while we may offer constructive criticism to what we love, we will not tolerate nonconstructive criticism that only serves to attempt to make what we love less enjoyable. We get enough of that outside of this blog, so we will not tolerate it here.This blog is also ran by a queer Black intersectional feminist.BEFORE YOU FOLLOW, KNOW THIS: I do make posts that discuss and call out fandom racism. I will not sugar coat anything on the subject.
